page.title: 20Buildings of Interest
page.content: Seal: "Kentish Yeoman". This is part of an early Tudor building. It was a court house, with a lime pit in the garden to dispose of corpses after hanging. Tunnel link to Church. Kemsing: "The Keep" and "Castlebank" These are 16th. century built as halls on the site of 12th.C. Kemsing Castle (demolished 14th. century) "Box House" facing the well, inhabited for over 1,000 years. St. Edith was born in this former convent. Present house dates from 1686. "Ivy Farm House" a former mediaeval hall, the oldest inhabited building in Kemsing. Kemsing Youth Hostel - a former 19th.C. Ragstone Vicarage. Noah's Ark: Noah's Ark Cottage is the oldest building in the area. Name given because of its ability to survive floods!
